job_title: Anonymous Employee in Winter Park, FL
pros: You will receive free tuition, hassle free after a year of service. The work atmosphere is SO fun and you can sneak away (without penalty, of course) to the events that take place on campus. You will receive discounts on food and bookstore items too! PTO days are the best. The campus is SO generous with giving days off during Christmas (2 weeks) and when there is construction, they allowed us to go home at 1pm every Friday for the inconvenience.
cons: The pay. Straight up, the pay. I was getting paid nearly 30% less than what I was offered and now making at my current skillset. You take the bad with the good and they are both 50/50 because working there is nearly worth it.

job_title: Camp Counselor in Winter Park, FL
pros: Rollins was a wonderful place to work assisting in their daily summer camp program.  The staff and administration for the camp were eager to help each other and the campers to learn and succeed in the various activities in which they participated.
cons: The only noticeable issue I had involved the time clock used for camp counselors.  We had been asked to fill out a time sheet on top of using the time clock due to some issues they were having with the clock.  Nobody checked the filled out time sheets though, which resulted in my having to argue and prove having been at work on a couple of days for which I did not receive pay.

review_title: Wonderful Work/Life Balance and Truly Great Benefits and Perks
job_title: Associate Director in Winter Park, FL
pros:
• TRULY great benefits (not just the typical "healthcare,  401k, and free coffee")

            
• Great work/life balance with a higher purpose.

            
• Beautiful campus architecture intertwined with the history of Winter Park.

                         
• Well-defined reporting hierarchy, yet small, "family feel" within each group.

             

   *** Coming from "corporate America", I discovered a welcome change! ***   

            
Considering the "total package" and not only the base salary, the value of the combination of the benefits, the beauty of the campus and its resources, cultural events, and general eductional and cultural level of Rollins faculty and staff is very high!

            
Benefits for full-time staff include:

            
• Rollins automatically contributes 7% to a 403b, the "non-profit version" of the  401k, with a three-year vesting schedule. Additionally,  100% matching of contributions up to 4.5%. Total benefit equals 16% given a 4.5% contribution. This is equivalent to 250% matching.

            

• 25 PTO days, advanced at the beginning of the year and accrued during the year, so they can be used as needed without the need to wait.
Additionally, all of the standard national holidays plus several additional days such as the day after Thanksgiving, the days around December 25th and the days around New Years Day.

            

• Potential for modified/flexible schedule, compressed workweek, and work-at-home arrangements.


            
• Free parking provided throughout the campus and Rollins' properties.


            
• Generous health benefits! Rollins staff members participating in the health plan receive, at no cost, $1500/year or $1800/year to spend towards medical expenses from sunscreen and band-aids to co-pays. This money rolls over from year to year and is portable after three years.

            

• Tuition remission after one year for staff member and family. Completion of a Rollins Masters Degree Program has an extremely high value.


            

• The college provides discounts for staff for meals in their cafeteria which provides gourmet meals worth three times the cost.

            

• Frequent physical and mental health initiatives help employees find their balance and improve themselves. Yoga, pilates, and other classes provided free of charge as well as access to campus gym facilities.
cons: none that I can think of

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Winter Park, FL
pros: The college is located in Winter Park, FL so there is sunshine all year round. Additionally, the facilities are very well maintained and the campus is extremely beautiful.
cons: Most of the students that you deal with on a daily basis are extremely arrogant. Additionally, there is not much room for advancement, each department has maybe one or two promotions from entry level however people stay for years and there is almost no growth in positions.

review_title: Data Analyst- as boring as it sounds.
job_title: Data Analyst in Winter Park, FL
pros: Rollins provided ample time off to accommodate my schedule. The manager was very nice and she was helpful when I had issues with the data platform.
cons: No room for advancement, I didn't really expect it but I think that there should be some system in place to allow for a supervisor to notice what other employees are doing.

job_title: Student Abassador, Diplomat, and Tour Guide in Winter Park, FL
pros: Get to meet potential new students and influence one of the most important decisions they will make: which college to attend.  The staff is fun too!
cons: My last year working their, they increased the amount of time each tour took and did not increase pay such that we were actually getting paid below minimum wage for the amount of time we were working.  Not cool.

review_title: Great place for employees to work and feel appreciated
job_title: Communications Coordinator in Orlando, FL
pros: The benefits here were outstanding. It's one of the few companies I've worked for that offered a generous maternity leave policy, as well as general paid time off. The benefits were affordable and quite satisfactory.
cons: Salaries were a bit low. Upward mobility can be difficult because the benefits are so good that it seemed turnover was low. It's a smaller institution so transferring to another unit for promotion was not always an option.

job_title: Student Assistant in Winter Park, FL
pros: Great work environment with awesome people. There's always something to do and it's fun answering college students questions and scheduling appointments. You can always help make marketing material or table at events.
cons: Limited work hours and must ask for permission to work extra hours.

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Winter Park, FL
pros:
-My team is supportive and friendly- the campus is very relational!

-Graduate Assistants are treated as staff- given responsibility for programs and often included in important decisions, our opinions are valued by upper administration
cons: My program is at UCF so paying the bills gets tricky with no tuition waiver.
